result.execSummary:
The defendant Miles William Bay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Expungment will be granted upon successful completion of probation

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles William Bay

defendant.name: Bay, Miles William
defendant.address: 2145 Glenhurst Road, St. Louis Park, MN 55416

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:06 p.m.  Defendant Miles William Bay in court with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan - filed amended information.  Def will plead to Count 1 of the Amended Information.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count  1 of the Amended Information.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 of the Amended Information.  Court orders S/W, 1 year probation, no specific conditions, court costs in the amount of $243.00, eligible for expungment upon succesful completion of probation.  Appeal rights given to defendant.
Def pleas not guilty to both counts. Court enters. Defendant to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing.

11:01 Defendant Miles William Bay in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sgt Scott Bangert swn, ex by OSullivan.  ID's defendant. Court: record will reflect indentification. Atty Bub x ex. OSullivan redirect. Court finds sufficient evidence the Def probably committed a felony, binds the Def over. OSullinvan files information; giving Def a copy.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives further reading.
Def knowing and willingly waives his rights to have a prelim with in 20 days.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 10:41 Defendant Miles William Bay in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Chris Bub appeared in Court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $3000 signature bond. Bub has no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:45 am.
